title: A Scottish mansion with extraordinary interiors: dragons hanging from the ceiling and a bathroom inspired by Kandinsky
text:
Monkton House, with its 7ft thick walls, gun loops, arrow slit and sandstone facade, sits grandly in Old Craighill just outside Edinburgh. Dating from the 15th century and largely remodelled in the 17th century, the house, its stables and retaining walls are listed Category A, while the two-acre gardens are a recognised ­historic landscape.

So far, so formal. Once through the front door, however, and a Narnia-esque scape unfolds. There is a Chinese room featuring dragons hanging from a sky-blue ceiling, with clouds inspired by the Brighton Pavilion and Buddhas painted across the panelling.

Upstairs is a vast bathroom, with murals based on the paintings of the abstract artist ­Wassily Kandinsky....
